intro: Astragalus torbathaydariyehensis, commonly known as the Torbathaydariyeh milkvetch, is a flowering plant species belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its erect or semi-erect growth habit and produces small, yellow to green flowers arranged in dense clusters. The plant typically has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is native to specific regions in Central Asia and is known for its ecological importance in stabilizing sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
